base.name: Regular Brussels Waffle
base.info: Brussels waffles,made with yeast, are big rectangular waffles that are crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside with large deep pockets.

base.name: Vegan Brussels Waffle
base.info: Vegan version of brussels waffles without the use of eggs in its recipy

base.name: Regular Belgium Waffle
base.info: Belgium waffles are very similar to the Brussels waffle, but it is made with baking powder instead which changes the consistency slightly.

base.name: Vegan Belgium Waffle
base.info: The recipy does not use dairy and eggs, but belgium waffles' texture and taste are saved anyway. Theyâ€™re light and fluffy on the inside and crispy on the outside, made with almond milk and with a slight nutty taste thanks to the ground flax seed.

base.name: Regular Pandan Waffle
base.info: This is the Vietnamese version of the waffle with a very interesting color, since one of the ingredients used to flavor the waffle is Pandan leaves or extract, which gives it a green color and also a nutty flavor.

base.name: Vegan Pandan Waffle
base.info: Eggs are not added in this recipy, but original taste and texture are fully saved

base.name: Regular Hong Kong Egg Waffles
base.info: Instead of the traditional pockets indenting a waffle, the Hong Kong egg waffle has egg shaped bubbles sticking outward that are easy to break off and snack on

base.name: Vegan Hong Kong Waffles
base.info: Vegan version of Hing Kong Waffle without using eggs in its recipy
